thread.title: Sebastien Montaz-Rosset'svideo of his evening jogs along Alpine mountains
thread.title_full: Sebastien Montaz-Rosset'svideo of his evening jogs along Alpine mountains | Daily Mail Online

author: Becky Pemberton For Mailonline
title: Sebastien Montaz-Rosset'svideo of his evening jogs along Alpine mountains
text:
View
comments
If you are scared of heights you may want to look away.
Little puts off daring Sebastien Montaz-Rosset, who not only scales the narrowest peaks in the French Alps, but tackles them at a run.
He has released terrifying GoPro footage of his runs over the Lac Blanc trail, which shows him scampering along it, undeterred by the precarious paths and 8,202-foot drops on either side.

Adventure filmmaker Sebastien Montaz-Rosset runs along narrow ridges at breakneck speeds in the Alps
With huge drops, precarious footing and ridges 8,202 feet above the ground, this is a morning run with a difference
Alpine runner Sebastien Montaz-Rosset captured breathtaking footage of his favourite running spots in the French Alps
The video shows the 40-year-old adventurer taking leaps of faith as he flings himself across tiny mountain ridges as part of his evening jog.
As the camera shows vertigo-inducing sheer drops on either side, it also reveals incredible views of a snow-capped Mont Blanc massif and the Chamonix Valley - a reward for his intrepid mission.
 Are we there yet? 'Big Crazy Family Adventure' sees parents... The female solo backpacker who braved civil war to capture... From a crocodile loose in the cabin to lost flights in the... With the camera mounted to his head, Montaz-Rosset can be seen sliding down snowy banks, using his arms to steady himself at the most treacherous moments.
Leaping over loose rocky crags, his jog would set most heart beats racing, even without it being attempted at speed.
The adventure filmmaker, who lives in Sallanches, France, is no stranger to the mountains, having spent most of his life playing and working in the Alps.
The 40-year-old filmmaker, who lives in Sallanches, France, shared the spectacular views from his daring routes across the rugged and often snow-covered terrain
The clips, taken by Sebastien in May and July this year, show scenes from the Mont Blanc region near his home
The footage shows the keen athlete pounding the terrain at dizzying heights
Sébastien said: 'I grew up in the mountains and have been climbing and doing mountain sports for as long as I can remember.
'There's always some risk in the mountains, but I've been running in places like this for a long time.
'I'm a mountain guide and have a lot of experience moving in the mountains.
'Spending time in the mountains is part of my life, it's a good way to clear my head and get some inspiration.'
The clip was one of the latest of his daring runs to be posted on his Facebook page , racking up over 23,000 shares in a few weeks.
He has also previously filmed frenchman Tancrède Melet attempting the first ever crevasse highline in Chamonix's famous Vallée Blanche.
To follow more of his spectacular adventures visit his Vime o page.
With the camera mounted to his head, Montaz-Rosset can be seen sliding down snowy banks, using his arms to steady himself at the most treacherous moments
Run with a difference: The 40-year-old is not put off by the uneven ground and loose rocks in the nail-biting video
Pay off: The reward for tackling the terrifying landscape are the magnificent views, appreciated on a short break in his jog
Montaz-Rosset is forced to leap between rocks to travel along the trail
Swaying to regain balance, the video captures his heavy breathing as he tackles the dangerous Alpine peaks
The runner is no stranger to the mountains, having spent most of his life playing and working in the Alps and appears to know the trail well in the video
The headcamera perspective shows the scary view down on the left hand side as he navigates along a rocky cliff face
